Articles.Content:
Just curiosu as to how many mods people think is to many. I'm currently sitting around 118 mods installed(ckan) + a few manually installed mods and ksp-avc giving me a tally of 76 installed add-ons

 

Spoiler

Well, im on 8gb ram laptop, so not too many! The chance of over 100 mods all working properly and playing nicely together....is probably uncalculable. I used to have 2 modded installs -

1. Stock parts list but with visual enhancement mods only. Sve,opm etc

2. Parts & tweaks mods only. Infernal robotic, tweakscale, mechjeb, firesptter. Etc

although, ive sort of stopped playing because the game keeps changing and we have to wait for the mod maintainers to catch up etc, so from MY point of view, ive been holding off from starting any meaningful game since 1.0.5. Which is a shame and tad annoying in one respect, but then theyre looking to still improve the game and with the staff that theyve assembled now, future looks bright, they certainly seem to be smashing through the code issues (fair play)

and ive gone off on a tangent  so, at most ive had bout 25 mods running (not without issues)
Module manager counts 10666 patches when I load the game, and I haven't noticed any performance changes since I was around 4500 patches.
